headline: Transgender Choreographer Takes on Toxic Machismo
abstract: Sean Dorsey explores masculinity in “Boys in Trouble” at New York Live Arts, but the power of his message loses its steam in this rambling work.
lead_paragraph: Is the choreographer Sean Dorsey really the first established openly transgender artist in the dance world? Mr. Dorsey is an important figure in the field, but by no means the only one; in terms of grants and awards, his San Francisco company, now in its 15th season, has made strides. And in November, he celebrated an unequivocal first: Wearing a T-shirt that read “I [heart] Being Trans,” he became the first openly transgender artist to land on the cover of Dance Magazine.
